Package svs

Class Candidate

java.lang.Object
svs.Candidate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Candidate>
public class Candidate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Candidate>
Contains the information used to describe a particular candidate in an election and provides methods to facilitate the distribution and redistribution of ballots during the course of an election. That is, this serves as a 'bucket' which can be used to keep track of which ballots belong to a candidate throughout the course of an election.

    Creates the Candidate for the provided name and ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • Candidate

      public Candidate​(java.lang.String name, int id)
      Creates the Candidate for the provided name and ID. Upon creation, the candidate has an empty (but initialized) ballot list.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the candidate (for example, "John Q. Public").
      id - a number used to denote the candidate being created.

  • Method Details

    • get_name

      public java.lang.String get_name()
      Returns the name of the candidate.
      Returns:
      the name of the candidate (for example, "John Q. Public")

    • get_id

      public int get_id()
      Returns the ID, the number used to denote a particular candidate.
      Returns:
      the ID of the candidate.

    • get_num_ballots

      public int get_num_ballots()
      Returns the number of ballots currently distributed to the candidate in their ballot list.
      Returns:
      the number of ballots currently in the candidate's ballot list.

    • reset_ballot_list

      public void reset_ballot_list()
      Clears the candidate's ballot list so that no ballots are distributed to them.

    • get_ballot

      public Ballot get_ballot​(int n)
      Returns the 'nth' choice in candidates for the ballot. The index, n, used to access this choice starts at zero. For example, to get the second choice candidate, 1 would be used. If the index used is not in range with respect to the rankings, then null is returned instead of a candidate.
      Parameters:
      n - the index representing the choice in candidates to access.
      Returns:
      the candidate corresponding to the choice for the provided index.

    • add_ballot

      public void add_ballot​(Ballot ballot)
      Adds, or distributes, a ballot to the candidate's ballot list.
      Parameters:
      ballot - the ballot to be added to the candidate's ballot list.

    • pull_ballot

      public Ballot pull_ballot()
      Pulls the last ballot on the candidate's ballot list. If the candidate's ballot list is empty, then null is returned instead.
      Returns:
      the ballot that was pulled from the candidate's ballot list.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Candidate compare_candidate)
      Compares the number of ballots between candidates. If a candidate has more votes than the candidate they are compared to, the number returned will be positive. If the candidate they are compared to has more votes, the number returned will be negative.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Candidate>
      Parameters:
      compare_candidate - the candidate to be compared to.
      Returns:
      the difference in the number of ballots between candidates.
